title: Geographical Detector(GD)
text: See layers NTDs.gpkg: file NTDs.gpkg, disease layer dependent variable, continuous numerical variable, others independent discrete variables. Now need combine layers together: Plot together:  Attribute spatial join Check whether NA NTDs: Filter rows NA values: Remove unnecessary columns data:
code: library(sf) library(tidyverse) library(gdverse) ntdspath = system.file("extdata", "NTDs.gpkg",package = 'gdverse') st_layers(ntdspath) ## Driver: GPKG  ## Available layers: ##   layer_name geometry_type features fields crs_name ## 1    disease       Polygon      189      2  unknown ## 2  watershed       Polygon        9      2  unknown ## 3  elevation Multi Polygon        7      2  unknown ## 4   soiltype Multi Polygon        6      2  unknown watershed = read_sf(ntdspath,layer = 'watershed') elevation = read_sf(ntdspath,layer = 'elevation') soiltype = read_sf(ntdspath,layer = 'soiltype') disease = read_sf(ntdspath,layer = 'disease') library(cowplot)  f1 = ggplot(data = disease) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = incidence),lwd = .1,color = 'grey') +   viridis::scale_fill_viridis(option="mako", direction = -1) +   theme_bw() +   theme(     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_blank(),     legend.position = 'inside',     legend.position.inside = c(.1,.25),     legend.background = element_rect(fill = 'transparent',color = NA)   ) f2 = ggplot(data = watershed) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = watershed),lwd = .1,color = 'grey') +   tidyterra::scale_fill_whitebox_c() +   coord_sf(crs = NULL) +   theme_bw() +   theme(     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_blank(),     legend.position = 'inside',     legend.position.inside = c(.1,.25),     legend.background = element_rect(fill = 'transparent',color = NA)   ) f3 = ggplot(data = elevation) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = elevation),lwd = .1,color = 'grey') +   tidyterra::scale_fill_hypso_c() +   theme_bw() +   theme(     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_blank(),     legend.position = 'inside',     legend.position.inside = c(.1,.25),     legend.background = element_rect(fill = 'transparent',color = NA)   ) f4 = ggplot(data = soiltype) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = soiltype),lwd = .1,color = 'grey') +   tidyterra::scale_fill_wiki_c() +   theme_bw() +   theme(     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_blank(),     legend.position = 'inside',     legend.position.inside = c(.1,.25),     legend.background = element_rect(fill = 'transparent',color = NA)   )  plot_grid(f1,f2,f3,f4, nrow = 2,label_fontfamily = 'serif',           labels = paste0('(',letters[1:4],')'),           label_fontface = 'plain',label_size = 10,           hjust = -1.5,align = 'hv')  -> p p NTDs = disease %>%   st_centroid() %>%   st_join(watershed[,"watershed"]) %>%   st_join(elevation[,"elevation"]) %>%   st_join(soiltype[,"soiltype"]) ## Warning: st_centroid assumes attributes are constant over geometries NTDs %>%   dplyr::filter(if_any(everything(),~is.na(.x))) ## Simple feature collection with 4 features and 5 fields ## Geometry type: POINT ## Dimension:     XY ## Bounding box:  xmin: 301567.5 ymin: 3989433 xmax: 318763.3 ymax: 3991906 ## Projected CRS: +proj=aea +lat_0=0 +lon_0=105 +lat_1=25 +lat_2=47 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs ## # A tibble: 4 × 6 ##   SP_ID incidence               geom watershed elevation soiltype ## * <chr>     <dbl>        <POINT [m]>     <int>     <int>    <int> ## 1 141        6.48 (318763.3 3991847)         9        NA        3 ## 2 165        6.53 (316574.1 3989433)         4        NA        2 ## 3 166        6.43 (311439.1 3990674)         4        NA        2 ## 4 188        6.26 (301567.5 3991906)        NA         2        3 NTDs %>%   dplyr::filter(if_all(everything(),~!is.na(.x))) -> NTDs NTDs ## Simple feature collection with 185 features and 5 fields ## Geometry type: POINT ## Dimension:     XY ## Bounding box:  xmin: 272784.9 ymin: 3982369 xmax: 333088.5 ymax: 4025117 ## Projected CRS: +proj=aea +lat_0=0 +lon_0=105 +lat_1=25 +lat_2=47 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs ## # A tibble: 185 × 6 ##    SP_ID incidence               geom watershed elevation soiltype ##  * <chr>     <dbl>        <POINT [m]>     <int>     <int>    <int> ##  1 0          5.94 (287216.1 4004408)         5         5        5 ##  2 1 5 4          5.96 (290924.8 4004432)         5         5        1 ##  6 5          5.66 (272784.9 4007758)         5         5        4 ##  7 6          5.74 (274308.9 4010571)         5         5 title: Geographical Detector(GD)
code: fd = gd(incidence ~ watershed + elevation + soiltype,         data = NTDs,type = 'factor') fd ##                 Factor Detector             ##  ## | variable  | Q-statistic |   P-value   | ## |:---------:|:-----------:|:-----------:| ## | watershed |  0.6377737  | 0.000128803 | ## | elevation |  0.6067087  | 0.043382244 | ## | soiltype  |  0.3857168  | 0.372145486 | plot(fd)

title: Geographical Detector(GD)
code: id = gd(incidence ~ watershed + elevation + soiltype,         data = NTDs,type = 'interaction') id ##                 Interaction Detector          ##  ## | Interactive variable  | Interaction  | ## |:---------------------:|:------------:| ## | watershed ∩ elevation | Enhance, bi- | ## | watershed ∩ soiltype  | Enhance, bi- | ## | elevation ∩ soiltype  | Enhance, bi- | plot(id)

title: Interactive Detector For Spatial Associations(IDSA)
code: library(sf) library(tidyverse) library(gdverse)  depression = system.file('extdata/Depression.csv',package = 'gdverse') %>%   read_csv() %>%   st_as_sf(coords = c('X','Y'), crs = 4326) depression ## Simple feature collection with 1072 features and 11 fields ## Geometry type: POINT ## Dimension:     XY ## Bounding box:  xmin: -83.1795 ymin: 32.11464 xmax: -78.6023 ymax: 35.17354 ## Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 ## # A tibble: 1,072 × 12 ##    Depression_prevelence PopulationDensity Population65 NoHealthInsurance Neighbor_Disadvantage ##  *                 <dbl>             <dbl>        <dbl>             <dbl>                 <dbl> ##  1                  23.1              61.5         22.5              7.98               -0.0525 ##  2                  22.8              58.3         16.8             11.0                -0.254  ##  3                  23.2              35.9         24.5              9.31               -0.0540 ##  4                  21.8              76.1         21.8             13.2                 0.0731 ##  5                  20.7              47.3         22.0             11                   0.763  ##  6                  21.3              32.5         19.2             13.0                 0.422  ##  7                  22                36.9         19.2             10.8                 0.113  ##  8                  21.2              61.5         15.9              8.57               -0.154  ##  9                  22.7              67.2         15.7             17.8                -0.320  ## 10                  20.6             254.          11.3             12.7                 0.457  ## # ℹ 1,062 more rows ## # ℹ 7 more variables: Beer <dbl>, MentalHealthPati <dbl>, NatureParks <dbl>, Casinos <dbl>, ## #   DrinkingPlaces <dbl>, X.HouseRent <dbl>, geometry <POINT [°]>

title: Interactive Detector For Spatial Associations(IDSA)
text: use spatial weight matrix SPADE vignette.
code: wt = sdsfun::inverse_distance_swm(depression)

title: Interactive Detector For Spatial Associations(IDSA)
code: tictoc::tic() idsa.model = idsa(Depression_prevelence ~ .,                   data = depression,                   wt = wt, cores = 12) tictoc::toc() ## 62.8 sec elapsed idsa.model ## ***     Interactive Detector For Spatial Associations  ##  ## |                                                                    variable                                                                     |    PID    | ## |:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------:| ## |             PopulationDensity ∩ Population65 ∩ NoHealthInsurance ∩ Beer ∩ MentalHealthPati ∩ NatureParks ∩ Casinos ∩ DrinkingPlaces             | 0.7273702 | ## |        PopulationDensity ∩ Population65 ∩ NoHealthInsurance ∩ Neighbor_Disadvantage ∩ Beer ∩ MentalHealthPati ∩ Casinos ∩ DrinkingPlaces        | 0.7265580 | ## |                    PopulationDensity ∩ Population65 ∩ NoHealthInsurance ∩ Beer ∩ MentalHealthPati ∩ Casinos ∩ DrinkingPlaces                    | 0.7249090 | ## | PopulationDensity ∩ Population65 ∩ NoHealthInsurance ∩ Neighbor_Disadvantage ∩ Beer ∩ MentalHealthPati ∩ NatureParks ∩ Casinos ∩ DrinkingPlaces | 0.7225422 | ##  * Number of overlay zones :  23  ##  * Percentage of finely divided zones :  0.002798507  ##  * Number of individual explanatory variables :  8  ##   ##  ## Different of response variable between a pair of overlay zones: ## title: Optimal Parameters-based Geographical Detector(OPGD)
text: Climatezone Mining discrete category variables ndvi data, need discretize others. can use gd_optunidisc() discretize based geodetector q-statistic. new.ndvi discreted result optimal discretization parameter based Q statistic geographical detector (factor detector), can combine columns ndvi tibble now.
code: tictoc::tic() g = gd_optunidisc(NDVIchange ~ .,                   data = dplyr::select(ndvi,-c(Climatezone,Mining)),                   discnum = 3:15, cores = 6) tictoc::toc() ## 2.08 sec elapsed g ## $x ## [1] "GDP"           "Popdensity"    "Precipitation" "Tempchange"    ##  ## $k ## [1] 15 15 14 14 ##  ## $method ## [1] "quantile" "quantile" "natural"  "equal"    ##  ## $qstatistic ## [1] 0.1096213 0.2100134 0.8809405 0.3478433 ##  ## $disc ## # A tibble: 713 × 4 ##      GDP Popdensity Precipitation Tempchange ##    <int>      <int>         <int>      <int> ##  1     8          6             5          3 ##  2     6          4             4          3 ##  3     8         11            10          3 ##  4     1          1             4          4 ##  5     1          2             4          3 ##  6     1          4             4          3 ##  7     8          6             4          3 ##  8     9          9             5          3 ##  9    12         12             7          3 ## 10     9         10             8          3 ## # ℹ 703 more rows new.ndvi = g$disc new.ndvi ## # A tibble: 713 × 4 ##      GDP Popdensity Precipitation Tempchange ##    <int>      <int>         <int>      <int> ##  1     8          6             5          3 ##  2     6          4             4          3 ##  3     8         11            10          3 ##  4     1          1             4          4 ##  5     1          2             4          3 ##  6     1          4             4          3 ##  7     8          6             4          3 ##  8     9          9             5          3 ##  9    12         12             7          3 ## 10     9         10             8          3 ## # ℹ 703 more rows new.ndvi = dplyr::bind_cols(dplyr::select(ndvi,NDVIchange,Climatezone,Mining),new.ndvi) new.ndvi ## title: Optimal Parameters-based Geographical Detector(OPGD)
text: , can run geodetector model gd() function.
code: gd(NDVIchange ~ .,data = new.ndvi,type = 'factor') ##                 Factor Detector             ##  ## |   variable    | Q-statistic | P-value  | ## |:-------------:|:-----------:|:--------:| ## | Precipitation |  0.8809405  | 9.18e-10 | ## |  Climatezone  |  0.8218335  | 7.34e-10 | ## |  Tempchange   |  0.3478433  | 2.41e-10 | ## |  Popdensity   |  0.2100134  | 1.61e-10 | ## |    Mining     |  0.1411154  | 6.73e-10 | ## |      GDP      |  0.1096213  | 4.18e-10 | gd(NDVIchange ~ .,data = new.ndvi,type = 'interaction') ##                 Interaction Detector          ##  ## |    Interactive variable     |    Interaction     | ## |:---------------------------:|:------------------:| ## |    Climatezone ∩ Mining     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      Climatezone ∩ GDP      |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |  Climatezone ∩ Popdensity   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## | Climatezone ∩ Precipitation |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |  Climatezone ∩ Tempchange   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |        Mining ∩ GDP         | Enhance, nonlinear | ## |     Mining ∩ Popdensity     | Enhance, nonlinear | ## |   Mining ∩ Precipitation    |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |     Mining ∩ Tempchange     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      GDP ∩ Popdensity       |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |     GDP ∩ Precipitation     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      GDP ∩ Tempchange       | Enhance, nonlinear | ## | Popdensity ∩ Precipitation  |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |   Popdensity ∩ Tempchange   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## | Precipitation ∩ Tempchange  |    Enhance, bi-    |

what: You can also use opgd() in one time to get result above.
title: Optimal Parameters-based Geographical Detector(OPGD)
text: can use plot() visualize result.  Use $opt_param get optimal discretization parameter OPGD model:
code: ndvi_opgd = opgd(NDVIchange ~ ., data = ndvi, discnum = 3:15,                  discvar = names(dplyr::select(ndvi,-c(NDVIchange,Climatezone,Mining))),                  cores = 6, type = c('factor','interaction')) ndvi_opgd ## ***   Optimal Parameters-based Geographical Detector      ##                 Factor Detector             ##  ## |   variable    | Q-statistic | P-value  | ## |:-------------:|:-----------:|:--------:| ## | Precipitation |  0.8809405  | 9.18e-10 | ## |  Climatezone  |  0.8218335  | 7.34e-10 | ## |  Tempchange   |  0.3478433  | 2.41e-10 | ## |  Popdensity   |  0.2100134  | 1.61e-10 | ## |    Mining     |  0.1411154  | 6.73e-10 | ## |      GDP      |  0.1096213  | 4.18e-10 | ##  ##                 Interaction Detector          ##  ## |    Interactive variable     |    Interaction     | ## |:---------------------------:|:------------------:| ## |    Climatezone ∩ Mining     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      Climatezone ∩ GDP      |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |  Climatezone ∩ Popdensity   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## | Climatezone ∩ Precipitation |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |  Climatezone ∩ Tempchange   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |        Mining ∩ GDP         | Enhance, nonlinear | ## |     Mining ∩ Popdensity     | Enhance, nonlinear | ## |   Mining ∩ Precipitation    |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |     Mining ∩ Tempchange     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      GDP ∩ Popdensity       |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |     GDP ∩ Precipitation     |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |      GDP ∩ Tempchange       | Enhance, nonlinear | ## | Popdensity ∩ Precipitation  |    Enhance, bi-    | ## |   Popdensity ∩ Tempchange   |    Enhance, bi-    | ## | Precipitation ∩ Tempchange  |    Enhance, bi-    | plot(ndvi_opgd) ndvi_opgd$opt_param ## # A tibble: 4 × 3 ##   varibale      discnum method   ##   <chr>           <int> <chr>    ## 1 GDP                15 quantile ## 2 Popdensity         15 quantile ## 3 Precipitation      14 natural  ## 4 Tempchange         14 equal

title: Robust Geographical Detector & Robust Interaction Detector(RGD & RID)
text: Install miniconda3 Open conda terminal perform steps 3 6 Create new conda env gdverse conda create -n gdverse python=3.10 -y Activate env conda activate gdverse Install mamba conda install -c conda-forge mamba -y Set python packages mamba install -c conda-forge numpy joblib pandas ruptures -y Configure GDVERSE_PYTHON environment variable Temporarily setting gdverse python dependence environment using Sys.setenv() R console R code like Sys.setenv(GDVERSE_PYTHON = "path//python/environment"). using usethis::edit_r_profile() Sys.setenv(GDVERSE_PYTHON = "path//python/environment") set long-available gdverse python dependencies environment path.

code: ndvi_rgd = rgd(NDVIchange ~ ., data = ndvi,                discvar = names(dplyr::select(ndvi,-c(NDVIchange,Climatezone,Mining))),                discnum = 3:8, cores = 12) ndvi_rgd ## ***      Robust Geographical Detector     ##  ## |   variable    | Q-statistic | P-value  | ## |:-------------:|:-----------:|:--------:| ## | Precipitation |  0.8883955  | 4.77e-10 | ## |  Climatezone  |  0.8218335  | 7.34e-10 | ## |  Tempchange   |  0.3722571  | 3.22e-10 | ## |  Popdensity   |  0.2205321  | 9.65e-10 | ## |    Mining     |  0.1411154  | 6.73e-10 | ## |      GDP      |  0.1164814  | 1.08e-10 | plot(ndvi_rgd)

title: Robust Geographical Detector & Robust Interaction Detector(RGD & RID)
text: RID allows obtain interactions possible combinations variables. default, Spatial Intersection used generate new spatial partition interaction variables.
code: ndvi_rid = rid(NDVIchange ~ ., data = ndvi,                discvar = names(dplyr::select(ndvi,-c(NDVIchange,Climatezone,Mining))),                discnum = 8, cores = 12) ndvi_rid ## ***       Robust Interaction Detector       ##  ## |   variable1   |   variable2   | Interaction  | ## |:-------------:|:-------------:|:------------:| ## |  Tempchange   | Precipitation | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Tempchange   |      GDP      | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Tempchange   |  Popdensity   | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Tempchange   |  Climatezone  | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Tempchange   |    Mining     | Enhance, bi- | ## | Precipitation |      GDP      | Enhance, bi- | ## | Precipitation |  Popdensity   | Enhance, bi- | ## | Precipitation |  Climatezone  | Enhance, bi- | ## | Precipitation |    Mining     | Enhance, bi- | ## |      GDP      |  Popdensity   | Enhance, bi- | ## |      GDP      |  Climatezone  | Enhance, bi- | ## |      GDP      |    Mining     | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Popdensity   |  Climatezone  | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Popdensity   |    Mining     | Enhance, bi- | ## |  Climatezone  |    Mining     | Enhance, bi- | plot(ndvi_rid)

title: Spatial Association Detector(SPADE)
text: SPADE explicitly considers spatial variance assigning weight influence based spatial distribution also minimizes influence number levels PD values using multilevel discretization considering information loss due discretization. response variable strong spatial dependence, maybe SPADE best choice. biggest difference SPADE native GD OPGD actual modeling SPADE requires spatial weight matrix calculate spatial variance. also developed sdsfun package facilitate construction spatial weight matrices, requires input sf object. spade function, provide spatial weight matrix, use 1st order inverse distance weight default, can created sdsfun::inverse_distance_swm(). can also use gravity model weight assigning power parameter sdsfun::inverse_distance_swm() function. using spatial weight matrix based geospatial contiguity. using spatial weight matrix based distance kernel functions. test SPADE model significance gdverse achieved randomization null hypothesis use pseudo-p value, calculation time-consuming. Default gdverse sets permutations parameter 0 calculate pseudo-p value. want calculate pseudo-p value, specify permutations parameter number 99,999,9999, etc. following section execute SPADE model using spatial weight matrix wt1.
code: wt1 = sdsfun::inverse_distance_swm(depression) wt2 = sdsfun::inverse_distance_swm(depression,power = 2) wt3 = sdsfun::spdep_contiguity_swm(depression, k = 8) wt4 = sdsfun::spdep_distance_swm(depression, k = 6, kernel = 'gaussian')

title: Spatial Association Detector(SPADE)
text: can also access detailed q statistics depression_spade$factor
code: depression_spade = spade(Depression_prevelence ~ .,                          data = depression,                          wt = wt1, cores = 12) depression_spade ## ***         Spatial Association Detector          ##  ## |       variable        | Q-statistic |      P-value      | ## |:---------------------:|:-----------:|:-----------------:| ## |   PopulationDensity   | 0.21532238  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |    DrinkingPlaces     | 0.18564821  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |        Casinos        | 0.17438646  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## | Neighbor_Disadvantage | 0.17235706  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |      NatureParks      | 0.17019859  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |     Population65      | 0.15592529  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |         Beer          | 0.09506759  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |   MentalHealthPati    | 0.07956353  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |   NoHealthInsurance   | 0.07753293  | No Pseudo-P Value | ## |      X.HouseRent      | 0.05621546  | No Pseudo-P Value | plot(depression_spade, slicenum = 6) depression_spade$factor ## # A tibble: 10 × 3 ##    variable              `Q-statistic` `P-value`         ##    <chr>                         <dbl> <chr>             ##  1 PopulationDensity            0.215  No Pseudo-P Value ##  2 DrinkingPlaces               0.186  No Pseudo-P Value ##  3 Casinos                      0.174  No Pseudo-P Value ##  4 Neighbor_Disadvantage        0.172  No Pseudo-P Value ##  5 NatureParks                  0.170  No Pseudo-P Value ##  6 Population65                 0.156  No Pseudo-P Value ##  7 Beer                         0.0951 No Pseudo-P Value ##  8 MentalHealthPati             0.0796 No Pseudo-P Value ##  9 NoHealthInsurance            0.0775 No Pseudo-P Value ## 10 X.HouseRent                  0.0562 No Pseudo-P Value

title: compensated power of spatial determinant(CPSD) — cpsd_spade
text: power compensated spatial determinant formula \(Q_s = \frac{q_s}{q_{s_{inforkep}}} = \frac{1 - \frac{\sum_{h=1}^L N_h \Gamma_{kdep}}{N \Gamma_{totaldep}}}{1 - \frac{\sum_{h=1}^L N_h \Gamma_{hind}}{N \Gamma_{totalind}}}\)

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## The following code takes a long time to run: library(tidyverse) fvcpath = "https://github.com/SpatLyu/rdevdata/raw/main/FVC.tif" fvc = terra::rast(paste0("/vsicurl/",fvcpath)) fvc1000 = fvc %>%   terra::as.data.frame(na.rm = T) %>%   as_tibble() fvc5000 = fvc %>%   terra::aggregate(fact = 5) %>%   terra::as.data.frame(na.rm = T) %>%   as_tibble() qv1000 = factor_detector(fvc1000$fvc,                          sdsfun::discretize_vector(fvc1000$premax,10,'quantile'))[[1]] qv5000 = factor_detector(fvc5000$fvc,                          sdsfun::discretize_vector(fvc5000$premax,10,'quantile'))[[1]] loess_optscale(c(qv1000,qv5000),c(1000,5000)) } # }

title: optimal parameters-based geographical detector(OPGD) model — opgd
text: formula formula OPGD model. data data.frame, tibble sf object observation data. discvar Name continuous variable columns need discretized. Noted formula discvar, data must columns. default, independent variables used discvar. discnum (optional) vector number classes discretization. Default 3:8. discmethod (optional) vector methods discretization, default using c("sd","equal","geometric","quantile","natural") invoking sdsfun. cores (optional) Positive integer (default 1). cores greater 1, use multi-core parallel computing. type (optional) type geographical detector, must factor(default), interaction, risk, ecological. can run one types one time. alpha (optional) Specifies size confidence level. Default 0.95. ... (optional) arguments passed gd_optunidisc(). useful parameter seed, used set random number seed.

text: list. opt_param optimal discretization parameter factor result factor detector interaction result interaction detector risk result risk detector ecological result ecological detector

title: shap power of determinants — spd_lesh
text: formula formula calculate shap power determinants. data data.frame tibble observation data. cores (optional) Positive integer (default 1). cores greater 1, use multi-core parallel computing. ... (optional) arguments passed rpart_disc().

title: shap power of determinants — spd_lesh
text: tibble variable corresponding \(SPD\) value.

title: shap power of determinants — spd_lesh
text: power shap power determinants formula \(\theta_{x_j} \left( S \right) = \sum\limits_{s \M \setminus \{x_j\}} \frac{|S|! \left(|M| - |S| - 1\right)!}{|M|!}\left(v \left(S \cup \left\{x_j\right\} \right) - v\left(S\right)\right)\). shap power determinants (SPD) contribution variable \(x_j\) power determinants.

title: shap power of determinants — spd_lesh
text: shap power determinants (SPD) requires least \(2^n-1\) calculations \(n\) explanatory variables. 10 explanatory variables, carefully consider computational burden model. large number explanatory variables, data dimensionality reduction method can used ensure trade-analysis results calculation speed.

title: gdverse 1.3-2
text: CRAN release: 2025-02-17 Experimentally support computing confidence intervals q statistic factor_detector (#51). Support adjusting font size q-value labels factor detection result plot (#49). Rename gd_bestunidisc gd_optunidisc (#39). Specify cores parameter functions gdverse package currently supports positive integer inputs (#36). Update documentation Python dependency configuration rgdrid vignette (#30). Discuss consistency results existing geographical detector R packages (#28). Update calculation method pseudo p-values SPADE model (#26).

title: gdverse 1.3-1
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-14 Fix bugs gd,opgd,gozh,srsgd plot s3 methods (#23).

title: gdverse 1.3
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-16 Redundant functions consolidated migrated sdsfun maintenance (#22). Reorganize parallel computing section gdverse (#21). Align RGD model original algorithm presented paper (#20). Now gdverse requires sdsfun minimum version 0.4.3 (#19). Transfer isp-related concepts functions cisp package (#18). Modify default font settings gdverse S3 plotting methods (#17).

title: gdverse 1.2
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-07 Set default number discretizations gdverse range 3 8 (#15). Optimize Python integration setup gdverse (#14). Now opgd() returns optimal discretization parameters (#13). Force data tibble format gdverse GDMs model function (#12). Align RID model algorithm original framework presented paper (#9). Beautify narrative writing details vignettes, without making changes user level.

title: gdverse 1.1-1
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-17 Clear WORDLIST ensure source code remains clean organized. Migrate source code ausgis/gdverse stscl/gdverse GitHub.

title: gdverse 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-10 general variable discretization gdverse now utilizes sdsfun::discretize_vector() (#6). Algorithm functions migrated sdsfun (#8).

title: gdverse 1.0-3
text: CRAN release: 2024-09-30 Update RGD Model API Settings (#2). Fix bug caused changes default parameters opgd sesu_opgd (#4). Maintain results st_unidisc ClassInt::classify_intervals (#5). parameter overlaymethod rid idsa renamed overlay. Add readr dependence type Suggests. Recompile vignettes due internal function changes.

title: gdverse 1.0-2
text: CRAN release: 2024-09-23 discvar input opgd, rgd, rid, spade functions NULL, assumed independent variables formula need discretized. Updating S3 method plotting various factor detectors better conform academic publication requirements.

title: gdverse 1.0-1
